medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with 2 days of abdominal pain, which has been increasing. She was seen one day ago, diagnosed with PID, and given antibiotics. An ultrasound done at that time showed a slightly enlarged right ovary but no evidence of torsion. The patient also reports nausea and vomiting. She denied fevers or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression/anxiety, Chronic cough, Shingles, Asthma as a child, Chlamydia diagnosis, IUD (Mirena)
medical_history.family_history: Mother is bipolar, father has hypertension, no cardiovascular disease, no sudden cardiac death.
